androidx.leanback.app

Interface BrowseSupportFragment.FragmentHost

  • Enclosing class:
    BrowseSupportFragment

    public static interface BrowseSupportFragment.FragmentHost
    Possible set of actions that BrowseSupportFragment exposes to clients. Custom fragments can interact with BrowseSupportFragment using this interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void notifyDataReady(BrowseSupportFragment.MainFragmentAdapter fragmentAdapter)
      Fragments mapped to PageRow are required to invoke this callback once their data is created for transition, the entrance animation only after receiving this callback.
      void notifyViewCreated(BrowseSupportFragment.MainFragmentAdapter fragmentAdapter)
      Fragments are required to invoke this callback once their view is created inside Fragment.onViewCreated(View, Bundle) method.
      void showTitleView(boolean show)
      Show or hide title view in BrowseSupportFragment for fragments mapped to PageRow.

    • Method Detail

      • notifyViewCreated

        void notifyViewCreated(BrowseSupportFragment.MainFragmentAdapter fragmentAdapter)
        Fragments are required to invoke this callback once their view is created inside Fragment.onViewCreated(View, Bundle) method. BrowseSupportFragment starts the entrance animation only after receiving this callback. Failure to invoke this method will lead to fragment not showing up.
        Parameters:
        fragmentAdapter - BrowseSupportFragment.MainFragmentAdapter used by the current fragment.

      • notifyDataReady

        void notifyDataReady(BrowseSupportFragment.MainFragmentAdapter fragmentAdapter)
        Fragments mapped to PageRow are required to invoke this callback once their data is created for transition, the entrance animation only after receiving this callback. Failure to invoke this method will lead to fragment not showing up.
        Parameters:
        fragmentAdapter - BrowseSupportFragment.MainFragmentAdapter used by the current fragment.

      • showTitleView

        void showTitleView(boolean show)
        Show or hide title view in BrowseSupportFragment for fragments mapped to PageRow. Otherwise the request is ignored, in that case BrowseSupportFragment is fully in control of showing/hiding title view.

        When HeadersSupportFragment is visible, BrowseSupportFragment will hide search affordance view if there are other focusable rows above currently focused row.

        Parameters:
        show - Boolean indicating whether or not to show the title view.

Generated javadoc for the new package structure to make it clearer which packages are bundled with the Android operating system, and which are packaged with your app's APK. Going forward, the android.* package hierarchy will be reserved for Android packages that ship with the operating system; other packages will be issued in the new androidx.* package hiearchy.
